reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, let me tell you a story about this game.

>be in prison level in game
>wandering around
>find gang leader about to be stabbed in cell
>acquire broken bottle
>stab the perpetrator
>gang leader joins my side
>lots of fighting
>kill many people with gang
>many gang members die
>grab orange
>head to solitary
>find a hulking prisoner
>give him orange via cell chute thing
>open solitary cell door using a button
>he joins my side
>me, the gang, and the hulking prisoner that I named George
>the gang dies, and it's just me and George against the remaining prisoners in the riot
>only 3 enemies left, including George. (you're supposed to kill everyone in the level, even allies)
>kill one of the 3, then George finished off the other
>he was facing away from me
>George slowly straightens up, and puts his fists down while still facing away from me
>I know what I must do
>slice him to bits with my machete that I stole from another gang leader
>I cry as I walk towards the exit, and finish the level

So, yeah, this game is truly a blast. It's extremely bloody and gory, with some secrets to find as well. Even while this game is in early access, it's amazing. It has so much replayability, and no level you do will be the same the next time. There are so many weapons to choose from as well. I'd give it a 7/10. I will tell you, although the game currently only has three complete levels, It's still amazing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*Picks prison level.
*Big Dave is my BFF.
*I must free him.
*Spawns and grabs a toothbrush shank.
*Straight for the showers.
*Only 1 guy showering in there and Tyrone standing watch.
*I wait...
*I wait some more...still no soap dropped.
*I go for the shot anyway.
*I throw my toothbrush jamming it deep within his backside.
*Insta-kill.
*Tyrone runs into the main hall and enters the brawl.
*I follow him grabbing a weight from the Gym area.
*I hurl the thing into a crowd taking out two guards.
*I look around and Tyrone is being shanked.
*Corpses everywhere.
*I make a run for solitary confinment.
*I must free big Dave.
*I take damage in some brawls along the way.
*So much blood everywhere.
*I arrive at solitary and grab a taser.
*I open the cell doors and big Dave emerges.
*The giant instantly charges me.
*Why big Dave?
*I hit him twice with the taser...
*He explodes my head with one punch.

10/10

Why Dave? It was all for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll get my criticisms out of the way:

- The game definitely has performance issues
- Weapon durability is a bit too low
- (In my opinion) enemies shouldn't follow you as tenaciously.  If I accidentally pass near a large group, I end up in a boring cycle of of running, hitting, running, hitting, picking off enemies one by one until the group is small enough to take on directly.  I don't mind that enemies chase you, but maybe have them split off and start fighting each other again after a while.

As for the good:

- Combat is awesome.  Feels very tight and responsive despite being simple.
- Gore effects are great.
- Physics feels satisfying!
- Interesting concept with promise of more maps to come!

Overall I'd totally still recommend the game, and I imagine the kinks will be worked out over the next few updates.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Video version

I find Paint The Town Red to be so much fun I actually have questioned a couple times whether this game has brought out some dark, deep-seated psychotic side in me. This is, without a doubt, the most entertaining beat-em'-up I have ever played. The combination of wacky yet semi-realistic physics, pixelated brutality (in impressive detail for a pixelated game), sheer amount of action taking place all around you at once, the amount of ways to beat the absolute sh*t out of people, and some of the most satisfying blows I have ever delivered unto another person, makes this, as I said, the most fun beat-em-up I have ever played. Allow me to, later on, go into more detail on most of these points.

There are only three levels out right now (Bar, Disco, Prison) as well as a sandbox level, as of this review. However, the developers seem committed to this game, and I am insanely jittery to see new maps being released at some point. Imagine a gym/wrestling ring, city block, mansion, fairground, subway...a bit of Gang Beasts comes to mind when thinking of levels that could be added to this game. And, as those new levels come out, hopefully along with even more weapons, character models, etc., I will be pouring WAY more time into this game than my current 9-10 hours shows, as of this review.

The way the blunt weapons, such as the bat or the baton, smack into your enemies' temples, causing copious and comical amounts of blood to spurt continuously from their face, and then having the next hit warranting their entire face to crumble into chunks as their body crumples to the ground(yes, this actually happens sometimes. I'll explain later), delivers, as I stated, some of the most satisfying combat and victories I have ever seen in ANY type of game.

The game isn't very far from the truth at all when it states you can use pretty much anything not nailed down to take out your opponents. Hell, in the prison levels, you can rip off the shower nozzles and use them as a weapon. YOU CAN THROW APPLES AT PEOPLE. I HAVE KILLED PEOPLE WITH APPLES. I HAVE PUT DENTS IN PEOPLE'S FOREHEADS WITH F***ING APPLES. THINK ABOUT THAT.

The amount of action going on around you for most of the fight, as you work to take out every other living being in whatever building you are dropped into, makes for a constant adrenaline rush as you uncontrollably spout profanities at the various enemies tromping towards you, weapons in hand. You are never safe until every last being is taken out, and, very much like in a real fight, you have to always look behind you to make sure someone is actually dead (even with the signature snare sound that plays whenever someone is dead, you still can miss a few people), or to make sure someone hasn't spotted you and started stalking you with their only goal being to cave your head in until they can use it for eating Ramen.

The physics have multiple chances each brawl to showcase their realism and their wackiness, depending on the scenario. Especially with the hard hitter" match modifier
date: kicking people with a full "kick" bar (or whateverthef*** it's called) sends them flying across the map
recommended: hitting the roof sometimes (not exaggerating) or getting booted up to a higher floor. In other scenarios
hoursPlayed: the way some of the weapons bounce off the walls

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The GIF replay feature is one of the strongest selling points but it's just bloody good fun. Even the voxel based art style is quite enjoyable.
Developer: South East Games
Publisher: South East Games
Release Date: October 13th, 2015

It’s just one of these days. You wake up late and rush to work. Of course you’re stuck in traffic. Great. You arrive at work , too late, and you get fired. On your way home your car dies for no apparent reason. Literally everything has gone wrong today and you have this urge … this urge to …
PAINT THE TOWN RED!

StoryThere’s no apparent story. You can make your own.
What we do know is that you’re in control of a bad ♥♥♥, one could even say, Chuck Norris.

But other than that the game’s focus isn’t story driven in case you were wondering.

GameplayPaint The Town Red runs pretty smooth. I haven’t encountered any apparent problems or bugs other than enemies ignoring me just because I’ve turned the water on in the public bathroom and decided to jump onto the sink. They just looked at me in disgust, while they were severely bleeding and looking at me with hatred in their eyes. Couldn’t care less to be honest.

Anyway. Paint The Town Red is a truly chaotic, first person, voxel based melee combat game. You’ll fight your way through different time zones and locations.
The default level is a classy one. It’s a Biker Brawl in Bitter City.
It’s tuesday, february 4th in 1992. One man vs the world. Well vs the everyone in the bar.

The next level is a truly funky one. It’s Saturday Fight Fever and boy it’s on!
On sunday , june 11th 1978, you’ll get just a tad too funky.

So you see you have a unique location and enemies through out the levels.

The goal is to beat the ever living shi … well is to pain the town read. That means that you have to defeat every enemy in the location.
You might wonder how? Well however you want! That’s the true beauty of the game.
You can use cups, a stool, a chair, a knife, a guitar … literally everything that’s lying around or being held by someone. A dude has a bottle that you want? Kick him in the face and send him flying because that’s your bottle! You want a knife? See those chefs over there? Just beat them till they drop it.
You can kick, jump, stab, punch, throw, block … You can do so much. Hell if you want you can watch some people fight to the death if you’re tired or need a break.

Eventually you’ll run into an enemy that you can’t kill that easily. Lucky you! You’ve found a boss.
Those guys are just a tad tougher but fear not! You have more power than them. I’m not kidding you literally do have powers. There’s a blue bar in the upper left that fills with each enemy that has been defeated and there’ll be a message on the screen once a power’s fully charged. So let’s talk about the fun stuff.

For example the shockwave! As the name implies you’re able to slam your knuckles together to create a shockwave that’ll send enemies flying. Best to be used if you find yourself in a tight spot.

Next up is Berserk! Boy that’s a bloody good one! Everything slows down and you turn into a one-hit-one-kill killing machine. Seriously. If you punch their head like once it just explodes. Kick the enemies and you obliterate them. Bloody good fun! Literally!

Last but not least is a truly god like ability … Smite. No not the game. That’s pronounced SMITE you doofus. I mean smite!
Well you point with your finger at someone and then you smite them. Basically a blueish light will shine on them and, as the name implies, smite them. Best part about it? You can use that from any distance. Not to mention you get to play god for a few seconds before your power runs out.

Overall the gameplay is bloody good fun!

VisualsLove it or hate it. The game’s using a voxel-based art style. It might not be everyone’s cup of tea, to be quite honest I never thought I’d like it, but I did quite enjoy it. Might also because of the dumb faces some enemies make while they’re trying to kill you. Or because you’ve cut the cheek off as you can see here
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=534527650
One of the good things about the art style is that it doesn’t look too serious. To be honest I found it quite hilarious to see a guy running around with half his skin shed from his head and showing all the world his magnificent white skull!
Not to mention you can even chop off the arms of your enemies.
There’s just so much good stuff to see and I think that the voxel approach was a good idea

AudioCan’t say too much about that. The music and the sound effects are quite good but nothing outstanding. My favorite track might the Funktown. Just sounds funky … Duh!

Animated GIF ReplayBy far the best feature in the game. It allows you to create GIF just by clicking two things.
Create GIF -> Upload gf to Gfycat -> ? -> Profit.
You can easily capture your best kills or funny moments and just upload them and easily show your friends. Or you can just brag at how awesome you are in the game.
Seriously this addition makes the game just so much better and I think that it was a splendid idea.
I’ve already used this feature to no ends and I don’t see myself ever stopping!

What else can I say?I have been lucky enough to get a Review Key for Paint The Town Red in order to write a blunt and honest to God Review. Just as usual.

It’s fun. It’s bloody fun.
I’m not going to lie folks but at the beginning I thought to myself: What’s the point?
But then I just found myself immersed into the game and was busy to literally Paint The Town Red and to just enjoy my killing spree. The enemies are challenging and easy at times but overall it’s just good. No to mention it does run really good considering that it’s an early access title. No to mention the possibility to easily create gifs. Such a good option seriously.

Overall I can only recommend this game. It’s just one of those games that you start up when you had a really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ day and guess what? You’ll find yourself in a better mood in a matter of minutes.
Get it folks. It’s worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far as I can tell, this game is great fun.
At first I thought the game was a simple beat 'em up game, to get rid of ones frustration and to have some short-timed fun without really care about some kind of health bar... but it turned out to be a far more challenging experience.
In fact you can die in about 5 to 10 punches of an enemy (not mentioning if they use weapons like baseball bats or even machetes) and you can be easily surrounded with 10 people who want to turn your inners outside. But unfortunately keeping distance and throw various objects at your opponents is way to easy to win such a brawl... I had more fun, running into the crowd, hit them down and crushing their stupid heads. Okay, I admit it is good in satisfy my sadistically root.
I was impressed how the damage model of the figures looks like; Every person in the game has skin and a full skeleton, it is possible to literally shred one to the bone. And of course you can decapitate them and chop their limps. In combination of blood (which’s certainly not overused) this is one of the most brutal games I had to play for years. The only thing I miss here are some painfully screams or angry shouts, to indicate more that those blocky figures are living beings... (I suddenly realize in which way I'm leading this review... I better go on with the maps...)

There are 3 complete maps right now, a fourth exists as a sandbox level where you can test AI and weapons and so on...
Every one of them (those three) comes with at least one unique boss with more HP and generally a personal weapon.
I will present them in a short list of information:The Bar
It is the easiest of all because of its sheer amount of objects laying around, such as chairs, glasses and plates, or a billiard queues as long ranged toothpicks (for eyes). I don't remember any particular highlights in this one, except that you can hit a rock band with its own instruments. A boxer and some cooks provide variety.
The Disco
This place is crowded, really! You don't have much space so step onto the dance floor and do what this game is all about.
In my opinion this is the hardest map of all three, most likely because of a Yakuza gang and their boss who 's endurance in person and a worthy opponent with his samurai sword. The best way to stay alive is to use hidden weapons such as Shuriken and Nunchakus.
The Prison
My most favorite map. You got a huge variety of objects; food, weights, barbells, shower heads, tasers, etc. and people who use them...
In this level you can see the wonderful love in detail that was put in. You can even be friends with a high-builded muscular prisoner, who helps you during the fight.
I hope more maps are incoming shortly... but at least you can have lots of fun with the existing.
I've also read there's a level editor with Steam-Workshop incoming, maybe it can bring some more variation.

But there's a little thing I want to criticize here; By killing people you earn points which can be sold in weather a shockwave, slow-motion with increased damage and an instant-kill- attack, available for a few seconds...
But why this? This is killing the atmosphere of a brutal and unreasonable fight. It is not a big thing because it's optional, but because it's still available urges you to use it. This makes the game too easy... remember when I called it a challenging experience in the first place? Maybe I was wrong by that.
I do not demand, that this should be put out of the game, no, certainly not, but rather an option tool that disables it.

Unfortunately there's no really good soundtrack behind the game, but I don't even miss one at this point, because of... uhm... metal-reasons.

Conclusion

Price- /Performance: Good -> 10 bucks is absolutely alright, if you are able to try out the levels more as once, you won't waste your money. Also a good gift option, but make sure the person you send it to has a computer that's good enough... there are still some performance issues so take a look on the system requirements!

Rating: Good -> A fun time brawler with great map design, I highly anticipate more to come out!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The man on the end of the bar is looking at you funny.
A Japanese crimelord wants you dead.
You've been incarcerated, even after you've pleaded not guilty.
It was self-defense, after all.

Let's paint the town red.

Paint the Town Red is, in a nutshell, a beat 'em up from a first person perspective. It's you and your blocky fists against many other blocky men in an orgy of blood and violence. Voxel violence.

Blows landed will bruise, cut, break, and dismember your enemies, spilling their square blood onto whatever surface is nearby. Anything and everything is a weapon. Bar stools, steak, bottles, afro combs, shuriken, bats, pimp canes... really, the list goes on. Nothing will stand in your way once you unleash your god-like special powers. Stack enough bodies and unleash shockwaves, pop men like balloons using nothing but your fists, and finally, call down the wrath of God and literally smite your enemies, reducing men into lifeless piles of wasted carbon.

The three levels available as of this writing are fun and colorful, bursting with personality and secrets, and they include:
-A biker bar where everyone wants to take a bite out of you
-A Saturday-night beatdown at the local disco
-A maximum security prison where dropping the soap is the least of your worries
There's even a sandbox level to play around with or to learn the finer points of Paint the Town Red.

Do I recommend this? Absolutely. Great for blowing off steam, laughing with the fun physics, or even feeling like the 90's action movie hero you always wanted to be.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is decent to those who like's to randomly stab someone and make everyone wanna punch eachother. But here are some pros and cons.

Pros
-When you throw the katana is goes through people, fun like hell
-The Pimp Cane Exploded the body part you hit, A but unrealistic but I don't give a damn
-If you're into blood this game has a lot of it, Even for punching
-The bosses make you panic and try to survive
-The levels are fun and there are many ways to kill someone
-There are powers that makes the game more easier for you and twice as fun

Cons
-Sometimes when you throw the katana through a certain amount of people, It begin's to think it's stuck inside someone, so it slides against the ground forever
-If you feel nausous seeing blood that is not real or decapicated people this is not for you
-Sometime's it takes too long to kill a boss and it gets boring after a while
-The NPC's Swing slowly, You swing when you click the mouse, They swing when you're not moving for 20 seconds
-Its easy to beat the levels if you don't pick a fight with the bosses of the levels

Overall, Its a great game. I see no issues with this and if there are any I am sure they are minor and easily removable/fixable and or improvable. My grammar is bad but I recommend buying it. The Developer is nice enough to add levels occasionally, He is currently adding a prison level so. Yeah.

Worth it? Yes, considering what more will come in 2016 (rougelike gameplay! guns! other roadmap stuff!)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Paint the Town Red.

How do I explain this ♥♥♥♥ing game?

Alright, Paint The Town Red is a Bar Fight Simulator. With one punch, swing of anything from a Beer Stein to a Katana and you ignite the massacre to end all massacres. You will end up killing at least 70+ people with everything including and not limited to, a beer stein, a whisky tumbler, pool cue, machete, toothbrush shiv, taser, money bundle and your fists.

You have access to powers such as Shockwave, which knocks everyone down. Beserk which will enter into a red tinted slow mo and any punch causes entire limb explosions, heads included. Smite, a former one from the original game prototype upgraded. Instead of a sniper, you get an orbital death laser than turns your enemies into giblets. So yes, you can scream Ludicrous Gibs.

So allow me to make my point by explaining some of the kills I've managed in a whopping 4 hours.

Duke Nukem style kicking a couple of bikers down a flight of steps.

Killing someone by smacking them with an apple.

Beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of a pimp with a barstool.

Stealing a hair brush out of someone's afro and embedding it into someone's face.

Beating a biker gang leader with a chair, stealing the machete he has and then getting it stuck in someone's head.

Beating a prison guard with a ham.

Fighting a ♥♥♥♥ing giant and winning by smacking him in the shins with a police baton.

I think I've made my point.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's not fair to review a less-than-half-done game, but given the quality of these entitled forum posts disguised as reviews, here goes:
Paint the Town Red is an early-access, first person Voxel based Brawler with a solid base experience which it is currently gaining fame for in all the right ways. The basic concept of organic cuboid gore and the wide variety of tools at the player's disposal from release have made the existing product a good example of an early access game.

So far the only given objective is to kill everyone, in the spirit of notable stylistic cousin Hotline Miami.
The Hotline comparisons are thick on the floor, save for the damage model and backstory. You can take multiple hits, as can foes, depending on what you hit them with and where. Reactions to those injuries are lacking somewhat, and multiple times  found myself wondering how the thug I'd just disfigured was continuing his assault unflinching with a face full of broken glass and chair splinters. The story is 'missing' - nothing is told to us, yet the title screen suggests we're either reliving memories or outright time traveling to sort history out one beatdown at a time, a far cry from Hotline's well buried and confusing world. (Not that all games need War and Peace for a backdrop of course)

The technical flaws it has so far are fairly usual for a Unity game in early development; framerate inconsistency, laptop processors having trouble, occasional clipping errors and a lack of in-depth settings currently sit on the game's shoulders, and are never shy about asking for your chips. At times,(usually when re-enacting the elevator scene from 'Driver') Voxel bloodspurts are so voluminous that the framerate chokes on those too.
The AI feign ignorance at times, but they always know where you are, and it can lead to a 'Conga of death' where half the level's population will seek you out and swarm you for an unseen bathroom murder.
Oh, one other thing, you can rebind the controls, but the main menu isn't the place to do it for some reason. You must currently be in a level to get the option to adjust control methods.

PVE multiplayer has been hinted by the Developers as on the horizon, and it would be welcomed, as will the mass of patches that will undoubtedly invalidate this review.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Today I learned how fragile humans are.
So, basically, Paint the Town Red is a fighting game. There is lots of gore, if you're into that stuff. The gore is a bit unique when compared to other games, or actually a lot. I mean, you've probably seen a head get busted and blow into bits... But HALF a head?
There is actually no story in the current version, as of 10/21/2015. The enemies don't immediatley attack you, giving you an opportunity to plan your approach in some levels. Attacking one of them would trigger the other enemies to attack other NPCs and you, just so they have something cool to do, while you're in the midst of combat. There are some destructable elements in the game other than people. Currently, in the bar level, on the second story, the rails may come off. More destructable objects in the game that could actually hurt the NPCs would be more fun, because basically, other than the railing breaking, that is it.
Weapons in the game though. You can nail people with pool marbles, stools, even steaks. Anything that you can grab, it's yours to fight with, so be creative with your killing.
Your character has power. Literally. Killing people will give you them. (Don't try this in real life though) If you're in a tight spot, just hold R" and choose a move. There's a shockwave
date: which sends your enemies flying quite like unrelenting force. It's not very lethal
recommended: but can come to your aid when you're surrounded by enemies. Berserk power will obliterate anyone you hit. Smite power allows you to do some laser thingy which also obliterates your enemies
hoursPlayed: if you click on them. In all
voteText: I think that Paint the Town Red is a game worth buying. It may be a little limited now
helpfulPercent: but soon the kind and god-like developers will soon add more content. (NPC relationships would be find. I help this guy in a fight
votesHelpful: and the next person he wants to punch is me?)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had a really fun time playing it. The gore was awesome, the gameplay was awesome, and the level design was awesome. I really think you should buy this game. At it's current state, there are only 4 levels: The biker bar, the disco, the prison, and the Pirate Cove. I beat them all and I only put in 2 hours in total from playing all of those levels in no rush. But the game is highly replayable so I still think you should get it. But maybe wait for a better discount like $5.00 maybe. The $8.00 I spent was kinda worth it, but at least I'm supporting the devs by paying more then the amount I would have liked to pay.

Overall I think I'll give it a 9/10. It's a great game, and I can't wait for more levels, the map editor, the arena mode, and the co-op.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game would benefit greatly from a level editor and a zombie mode. In fact, a zombie mode would be perfect in a game with this much gore. The zombies could be dismembered and still live until you bash their heads enough, Also, the AI seems to focus on the player to the extent that massive hordes of guys all come after you instead of attacking each other. This is especially evident in the Priseon level. In that level, why do guards attack each other? There should be some kind of smart AI system. So far so good. Can't wait for the coming updates!

P.S. Please add in a flintlock pistol in the Pirate Cove level!

P.P.S. Please make it possible to disable the drum kill sound. Also it would be cool if when you throw knives, it gets stuck in the enemy's body. And heads fall off too easily. Thanks!

P.P.P.S. Fall damage? Endless mode?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I find this game to be very fun and I recomend it as a time waster or relaxing game. What I will list next are not complaints, but suggestions that could be added in the game to make it even better.

These features might be welcome (especially if they are toggle on/off features):

- Collision Based Damage: This would make tossing an enemy against a wall or furniture more relevant.

- Fall Damage: Similar to the above it would make kicking enemies and falling off heights relevant.

- Realistic" Blood Mode: In the game's current state just punching an enemy causes him to bleed profusel. A mode that made the blood spurts more adequate to the damage done would be welcome as well. Bleeding profusely would be achieved by stabbing an enemy
date: "breaking his nose" or caving his head in
recommended: but still more tame than the current more cartoonish mode. This would also make it more challenging to paint the maps RED. Requiring more violence to really get that bloodbath result.\n\n-Dangerous Unarmed or Bruce Lee mode: Although there is the Hard hitter mode (makes enemies fly further) I find that I would like to replicate Kung Fu movies and go through a stage bare handed. It is possible to do so in normal mode (if played carefully)
hoursPlayed: but I would really like a mode that caters to that specifically. Higher damage and Easier Stuns with fists would be nice in this mode. Some visual and audio aditions might be nice too. Like Chinese Kung Fu characters and sound effects.\n\n-Kung Fu Themed Map: Regardless of the previous item

it would be REALLY nice to get a kung fu themed map. Like a shaolin temple or a tournament setting.

votesTotal:
just fly through an enemies head as if they were bullets.

I really do recommend the game. Just tons of mindless fun.
Hope the devs get a chance to read this."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Have you ever wanted to beat the living tar out of someone? Good this game is for you.
Here's a list of pros and cons:

Pros:
All around fun
Environment is destructible
Amazing gore
Amazing voxel dismemberment
Use almost everything as a weapon
Good graphics
Funny physics
I have to really lay into the other AI
Slightly realistic
It has nunchucks and a katana
Superpowers are useful but not too OP

Cons:
Can be hard to run on an older PC if you have one
Physics and gore can cause constant FPS drop (this is to be expected though)

With all this said I played the game when it was a 7 day FPS free title. The developer took that idea and made it 10 times better. One of my favorite indie games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Remember one of the penultimate fight sequences in Kill Bill Vol 1 where Uma Thurman is surrounded by The Crazy 88" Yakuza swordsmen and proceeds to defeat them in a long and extraordinarily bloody sequence? Have you ever wanted to play a game where you felt that tremendous sense of "One Against All" in a way that felt equally thrilling and brutal as that scene?

Meet Paint The Town Red.

The setup is very simple: Enter an area with a large amount of individuals (presently a bar
recommended: find a weapon (or don't) and proceed to kill everyone. Kill enough enemies and you unlock the first tier of a special "power". Don't use that power and kill more and you advance to a more powerful tier
hoursPlayed: continuing on to the third respectively.\n\nIt's an astonishingly simple setup which is just too good to deny. Smashing a chair over someone's head before running across the room to grab a bottle
voteText: which I throw into the face of one of two individuals surrounding me. With a large group in pursuit
helpfulPercent: I run into a supply room and grab a guitar and come out swinging - taking down several individuals before I activate my power
votesHelpful: sending the large group of seven flying across the tables and chairs that litter the bloodsoaked floor.\nAesthetically it's just ludicrously appealing
votesTotal: seeing pixelated seas of blood bathe entire rooms in seconds after you stab a mob boss in the face and then punch his bodyguard across the room. Watching the faces of tougher enemies fall apart
votesFunny: gushing blood before they eventually fall after repeated pummelings with objects.\n\nThere could do to be more content in the game
commentsCount: e.g: weapons (and I'd love to see a cinema level)
column16: but what is supplied here at the minute is more than enough to keep you playing for hours.\n\nPaint The Town Red is sheer
column17: all out war. It's a hell of an experience that grabbed me straight from that Kill Bill feeling I got the moment I started fighting someone
column18:
all the way to being cornered in a room with a tire iron while furiously smacking at everyone around me.

Stick on some smooth jazz or some beatdown hardcore and get swinging.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: PIRATE'S COVE IS AWESOME https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iz5Zz2Arp0I

This game. Oh boy, this game. This is an Early Access game (which has become an ugly title, I know), but dear god it's done the way Early Access is SUPPOSED to be done. The game is cheap, it's fun, it's entertaining, and the developers are frequently updating and supporting the game. They listen to the community, they listen to what we have to say and it shows in the quality of this simple, yet absolutely fantastic title.
Paint the town red is a bloody, gorey mess of a beat 'em up game with lots of weapons, lots of physics and gibbing, and it's easily worth $9.99. The graphcis are basic but extremely effective, the sound track is awesome and the gameplay and fighting feels great. Yes, I'd recommend this game. Even with how little content there is now (only three levels and a sandbox mode, but they just added level modifiers) this game is still easily worth $9.99 in its current state. I'd fully recommend it, and I've even done multiple videos of it on my YouTube channel.
Easily a 9/10. Buy it.

EDIT: They just added level mods. Holy hell they're fun. I sat down and did one called Machete Time" where the AI all have machetes equipped while I was completely unarmed (No powerups used either).
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5umYu29Z4Io"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Have you ever wanted to beat the living tar out of someone? Good this game is for you.
Here's a list of pros and cons:

Pros:
All around fun
Environment is destructible
Amazing gore
Amazing voxel dismemberment
Use almost everything as a weapon
Good graphics
Funny physics
I have to really lay into the other AI
Slightly realistic
It has nunchucks and a katana
Superpowers are useful but not too OP

Cons:
Can be hard to run on an older PC if you have one
Physics and gore can cause constant FPS drop (this is to be expected though)

With all this said I played the game when it was a 7 day FPS free title. The developer took that idea and made it 10 times better. One of my favorite indie games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Paint The Town Red is a chaotic first person combat game, where we take place at different locations to release our inner madness, too become a ultimative serial killer.

When playing Paint The Town Red, we quickly discover a detailed gore game, where we have options to slice people in every way, like the good old times in postal and hatred. Yet that we can throw a glass of beer in the face of the guitar player, then we also can use our 3 special abilitys that activates at 3 stages, when killing people. We have a great character control and combat movement, when talking defending our self or kicking a guy out of the balcony on first floor.

Currently Paint The Town Red offers two maps, which is the bar and disco. Each locations has some small 'bosses', like a mob, pimp, rocker boss etc. Yet that these strong in-game npc's can slice you up with a sword, the staff of each locations aswell don't fear to take a knife to show you how to remove arms from people. The game it self offers a keyboard aswell a controller support, to release your inner killer.

Not only has the game two maps too offer, but suggestions from the community will make the game even better since there is so many ideas that this first person fighting game fit into. I hope with my whole hearth, that the developers add a multiplayer for the ultimate fun. If you love and search for a game to hurt people in the moste brutal ways, this game is worth the shot.

Here is a demo:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9NTmWlyQvZg&list=PLxDx_O1l8oBsLpg2i7BMkf2xGyEgVJq_I

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Standing nonchalantly in the upstairs of the bar, glass in hand, listening to the cute little band playing below I stared over at the guys in the bar. Some of them gave me shifty glances. It was my first go on Paint the Town Red and I wasn't sure what to expect... I just knew I was meant to fight! Remembering my favourite scene from the film Train Spotting I thought my best option was to grab a glass and wing it over the edge of the balcony into a random guys head. It shattered and sent him to the floor, blood spurting from the wound. As soon as I did this the music changed to a funky acton beat, fitting for the carnage which was about to take place.

Suddenly all hell broke loose and I kicked the guy infront of me - sending him smashing through a wooden table before stomping his head into the floor - taking some strange satisfaction in this brutal act. Before I could finish my fun" another drinker cracks me over the back of the head with a pool cue.

This was the first 5 minutes. It just continued to get better. Not *loads* of content
date: but the developers seem to be updating weekly at the moment with promises of lots more - and the current content is easily worth the asking price. More people should know about this
recommended: it really is great!\n\nIf you enjoy big brawls and lots of gore
hoursPlayed: get it. You won't regret it!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is EASILY one of the best games I've played! The physics are AMAZING, The customer service is the best I've seen!
I was having trouble starting this game and the creaters RESPONED THE NEXT DAY and that is dedication! (Thanks Matthew!)

This game is brilliant! Its a unique idea twisted with physics and blood and gore. The graphics are great, the weapons actually feel real, as if your really swinging an actual sword.

The levels variaty are also good, one minute your in a biker brawl, the next a prison riot! very creative and interesting.

The layers to the people are also very unique, the skin, muscle layer and bone layer make it very fun when destroying everything. you can slice and mangle everywere on the human body. the bosses are also a great idea!

So I rate this game 10/10 One of the best I have ever played!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The ultimate pub brawl simulator, the objective of Paint the Town Red is ridiculously simple: brutally murder as many people as possible using just about anything from pool cues to samurai swords to your own two fists without yourself being beaten up and killed.

Despite its simplicity, there is a fair amount of enemy variety and replayability. Each level has a boss, with a powerful weapon and a lot of health at his disposal, and his heavily-armed henchmen alongside the standard mooks. For a voxel-based game, the injury system is incredibly complex and highly detailed: enemies can be bruised, extremities can be hacked off and blood will be spilled from their wounds - and there are many more methods of committing GBH and ultimately murder for a suitably-haematolagniac player to explore.

Paint the Town Red has truly impressed me as a game, not least in which it has proven that a game where all there is to do is slaughter bar patrons can indeed be more enjoyable than a hugely-complex war game with the most advanced graphics and realistic gunplay to date ... Black Ops III.

This is EASILY one of the best games I've played! The physics are AMAZING, The customer service is the best I've seen!
I was having trouble starting this game and the creaters RESPONED THE NEXT DAY and that is dedication! (Thanks Matthew!)

This game is brilliant! Its a unique idea twisted with physics and blood and gore. The graphics are great, the weapons actually feel real, as if your really swinging an actual sword.

The levels variaty are also good, one minute your in a biker brawl, the next a prison riot! very creative and interesting.

The layers to the people are also very unique, the skin, muscle layer and bone layer make it very fun when destroying everything. you can slice and mangle everywere on the human body. the bosses are also a great idea!

So I rate this game 10/10 One of the best I have ever played!

I walked into the bar, looking for the smug son of a ♥♥♥♥♥ that stole my woman from me. I walked across the stage area, through the pool tables and saw the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ standing there, drinking a beer. Then I went home and loaded up 'Paint the Town Red.' Decent game, for Greenlight.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI picked this up on a whim after finding it in my discover queue and have been pleasantly surprised. I don't normally purchase early access games, but the sale price, the description and the positive reviews convinced me to take a chance. Right now there isn't a ton of content, but what's there is very fun. Chaotic battles abound in these 3 levels and seeing your enemies come apart, piece by tiny piece is both horrifying and pretty damn cool. Even when I don't complete a level it's a great way to blow off some real world stress. Plus there is a sandbox level where you can spawn numerous weapons and enemies as well as enabling all sorts of cheats to just play around with.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nEin sehr unterhaltsames Spiel, zumindest für ein paar Stunden. Man muss in einem Level eine Schlägerei anfangen und jeden töten, sobald man jemanden schlägt, geht es los. Daraufhin fangen alle an, sich zu verprügeln und wollen dem Spieler natürlich auch ans Leder. Es ist möglich, die meisten Gegenstände aufzuheben um damit um sich zu schlagen oder sie zu werfen. Das Werfen von Dingen ist besonders bei den stärkeren Gegnern nützlich, von denen es in jedem Level einen gibt. Das Spiel sieht so ähnlich aus, wie Minecraft, alles scheint aus Klötzen gemacht zu sein. Am beeindruckendsten ist allerdings die Gewaltdarstellung, es ist einfach ein riesiges Blutbad, da es sogar möglich ist, Gegnern Gliedmaßen abzutrennen oder so lange auf den Bauch zu treten, bis die Rippen zum Vorschein kommen. Das einzige, was ich aktuell noch bemängeln kann ist der Umfang, es gibt nur 4 Level, einen Pub, eine Disco, ein Gefängnis und ein Testlevel. Aber da das Spiel aktuell noch Early Access ist, wird da sicher noch mehr kommen, deshalb empfehle ich es.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun for the whole family.. If your family is a bunch of sadists. Paint the Town red is a great stress relief game, and is super addicting to play. The objective of the game is to kill everyone else in the level and become the only one, then walk out all cool with a mess of blood and mutilated bodies behind you.

Combat
The combat is great, and it has to be, considering this game is all about fighting. You can pick up most items around you, including bar stools, mugs, chairs, pool ques, pool balls, knives, bats, nun-chucks, katanas, throwing stars, shot glasses, tire irons, pimp cains, and more. They usually break pretty fast though, which forces you to run around constantly grabbing things to use as weapons and gives the combat this improvisational feel. You can do light punches if you tap, and heavy punches if you hold. There's a block button so you can take reduced damage, but generally I see little use for it when you can just dodge very easily by backing up. Unless you're cornered block really has no purpose. Then theres kicks, you have a knock down bar that when full lets your kicks knock people over, it depletes entirely once you use it and constantly fills back up at a quick pace. One of my favorite things with kicks is dropkicking, if you time your jump and your kick just right you can do one, but it can be pretty hard at times. As for weapons they use the same mechanics as punches, but light hits are jabs, heavy hits are swings, and you can throw them. Sometimes your hits stun opponents letting you just wail on them until they recover or go down.

Specials
There's three special abilities that use a blue bar, which charges up when you kill people. The first one costs a third of your bar and does a shockwave knocking anyone in your immediate area down, it's called shockwave. The second ability, berserk, slows down time, and lets you explode peoples faces in prosnorkulus style fashion with your punches, using two thirds of your bar. Smite, the third and final ability, using a full bar, slows down time and lets you shoot people with your hand spirit gun style, causing them to be obliterated into nothing with a beam from the sky. The second and third ability sometimes dont work, which is really annoying, and they waste precious slowed time doing an animation. Sometimes due to this you'll only get to kill one or two people with berserk or smite, sometimes none at all, which is just a total waste of your bar, and can be really infuriating.

Bosses
There's a boss or two on every level, of which there are only two right now (The Bar, and Club beatdown),  but there will be more to come. These guys usually carry a super deadly weapon, and have some ridiculous durability. They're unaffected by your special moves and your kicks, and they can take so many bottles to the face it's hilarious. You can fight them at any time you find them in the level, and usually they come right after you once you do. As for their ridiculous durability, these guys will generally have half their skull hanging out their head and still come at you. But once you get their weapon it usually one hit kills everything you come accross until it breaks. Boss weapons have slightly more durability than others but still break pretty quickly if you have a bunch of opponents left. A nice detail for the sadists out there, your weapons take zero durability damage from smacking corpses so you can mutilate things as much as you like.

Conclusion
Overall I love this game, and despite a couple issues with specials, and lack of optimization, I can see me and my friends taking turns on this game for hours just in its current state. Which kinda makes me wish there was some local coop/deathmatch support in the future. But anyways, if you like senselessly gorey brawls, and/or your looking for a way to outlet your rage, then I recommend you [try] Paint The Town Red.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really like the style of this game and the gameplay, it's fast paced and everyone gets all up in your face when ♥♥♥♥ hits the fan. I hope multiplayer is involved and some sort of leveling system is introduced later. This game has a ton of potential and I look forward to watching it grow either through the steamworkshop with maps, skins, weapons, attack moves, and powerup customization. Being able to create your own gifs of your fury is great which you can upload it as artwork and use it on your steam profile. However, the frame rate gets a little choppy when everyone starts throwing things at eachother and you will not get over 60fps with SLI 970's and I7 4790k.

TLDR; I hope it gets optimized a little more but overall I recommend it for what it is at the current state as a fun and entertaining game with a lot of potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game looks nice, and it is for the first 10 minutes. Afterwards it becomes the same thing over and over. Hit, run away. Hit, run away. Hit, run away. The AI is incredibly stupid. For a game that's supposed to be a beat em' up fighting game, it has terrible AI. If you hit one guy, he'll only come after you, even if someone else hurts him. This can cause you to get a horde of people chasing after you. Not like this is a problem ofcourse, because you can just Hit. And. Run. Repeat. or H.A.R.R for short.

Later on in development, if the devs whip up a better AI system so players aren't just H.A.R.Ring all the time, it'd be well over worth the $10 asking price. I'd gladly pay $20 or even $25 for this exact game, with better AI (and all the maps ofcourse, but those will come in time...)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://youtu.be/tpUesNlDTSU
Game: Paint The Town Red
Genre: First-person Brawler
Developer: South East Games
Publisher: South East Games
Copy supplied by Steam

Paint The Town Red is a first-person brawler game developed and published by South East Games. It is currently available in Early Access, and the developers are fixing bugs and adding new things almost every week.

GRAPHICSThe game is seen from a first-person perspective, and it looks fairly good: the blocky characters that you fight are nicely varied and feature different facial animations, the blood that spills from their wounds really paints the whole level red, and the level design is well done, with hidden weapons and such that reward your exploration. There are a couple of animations bugs, like beheaded enemies that are still alive, or doors that glitch out of existence, but it performs really well and I haven't found anything annoying.

GAMEPLAYYour goal is simple: start a brawl and be the last man standing. You can use your fists, your kick (which makes your enemies fly in the air), or you can pick up almost everything that you find in the levels, from chairs and beer bottles, to baseball bats and katanas and guitars, as well as a shotgun (the only firearm currently available). The weapons are powerful but break down after a couple of hits.
There is also a Power Meter, which grants you three different special moves: a Shockwave (which makes every enemy near you fly away), Berserk Mode (which gives you a one-hit kill for every punch you throw), and Smite (you point your finger at an enemy and he blows up). This helps turning this already violent game in probably one of the bloodiest I've ever played, making every game session engaging and rewarding.
Unfortunately, the game lacks a lot of variety, and after a while you will get a bit bored of it. But after one or two days, it will be just as exciting as the first time.

CHALLENGEExcluding the mini-bosses that you find in each level, every enemy goes down with a couple of hits from the weapons you find, so they aren't that hard to kill. However, when there is a mob of people that puts you in a corner, they easily overpower and destroy you, making everything a bit more frustrating than it could have been.

SOUNDThe sound effects are spot on, and every hit from punches and weapons gives you an adrenaline rush. The music from Kevin McLeod fits the game very well, and even though the tracks aren't all that memorable, they are very fun to listen to while playing.

REPLAYABILITYThe game now has three levels (a bar, a disco floor, and a prison) and a Sandbox Mode to try out different weapons and attacks. There are also some modifiers that you can use (like giving every enemy a machete, or giving you unlimited power) to spice things up a bit and making the whole experience fun every time.

Overall, this is a very good game to play when you have thirty minutes of free time or when you are upset: it is rewarding, it is fun and it doesn't last long. I strongly recommend supporting this game, especially because the developers are constantly fixing the bugs and adding new features to satisfy the fans. I can't wait to see what they will give us next.

Story: n/a
Graphics: 8.5
Gameplay: 8
Challenge: 9
Sound: 8
Replayability: 8.5

ENJOYMENT: 8
FRUSTRATION: 6.5

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a lot of fun for a few minutes but as it stands there's not enough gameplay to make it worth ten bucks.  Give it a while, but don't buy it now.

Pros:

Full voxel dismemberment
The goofy Thirty Flights of Loving aesthetic
Hitting a guy on the ground over and over and over until his face is a bloody mess

Cons:

Enemies glom onto you in big packs, forcing you to kite them around. Sometimes it feels like a zombie game.
Most weapons only last a few hits.  For improvised weapons that's fine but machetes and stuff should last longer.
The goofy Thirty Flights of Loving aesthetic
Not enough content for ten bucks.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

'' Have you ever got that feeling that this was made specifically for you? well thats what I felt when I played this game. ''  Yeah thats what I felt when I played this, as i've always wanted to punch someone face in so much that I can see their skull.
This is going to be a pretty big and indepth review on this game so I hope you find this helpful!

==Gameplay==

The gameplay is quite simple with only a few machanics such as picking things up, throwing things, punching/swinging etc. There is power ups which are fun to mess around with but the simple gameplay means you can jump right in without having to go through a long tutorial, but what really makes the mark in this game is it's gore engine, the gore engine is one of the best i've seen so far, you can shank someone which would leave a gaping hole in their body, you can beat someones arm off with a baseball bat and you can slice someone in two. There is also kicking and sparta kicking in the game which just adds on the fun factors of the game.

==Engine/Graphics==

The graphics to me are pretty neat as most things/people are made up of small blocks even the blood is made of blocks
The engine is okay but to me it needs improving as looking at some places in the bar dropped my fps to around 30 but I didn't have these issues in the sandbox and disco. The gore engine is amazing like I have said, another thing nice about it is blood and bodys stay in the map.

==Sounds/Music==

The sounds are pretty good but nothing to really go on about, the music is nice and fits in with the fights, so at the disco funk music and at the bar rock music.

==Vertic==

Amazing game highly recommend picking it up if you want to lose some stress, but the engine needs improving.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very good start to a potentially great game! Some more variety in levels and weapons and this could be a really fantastic game. Also the feature to make a gif at any time is a brilliant idea and is going to lead to some great moments that won't be missed cause you weren't recording!

The gameplay in it's current state isn't exactly full of finess, but the game plays pretty fair overall, only one glitch did I encounter and it didn't harm my game in anyway. The sheer brutality you can give out is the real highlight here. And for a game with blocky graphics I'd say it looks pretty good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is simple yet very fun and enjoyable as a casual. It never gets old as you can do a lot with the physics in game,

Pros:
+Amazing gameplay
+Awesome physics
+Fun to play and relax with
+Great fighting mechanics
+Cool gore concept

Cons:
-Preformance issues
-Seems to be a simple game but lags a ton for me
-Enemies tend to follow you literally everywhere

In all great game. I am going to post my computer specs and maybe that'll show why i'm getting low frames? I seem to have all of the right parts. Message me if you could help.

My specs:
-AMD A4-6300 APU with Radeon HD Graphics 3.7GHz
-7.00 GB RAM
-64-bit OS

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGreat game that is fun to watch or play at a friends house. It is very fun but the gameplay is repetative.  It has limited stain power but if they came out with more maps (mabye 5) it would raise the games worrth to 20 dollars. Some map ideas are Zombie Town, Cruise Ship, and Party Crasher. If these maps became a reality it would help the game a lot. Even though the game is not fully developed I think they could have done better. I would recommend this game for people who have anger issues, voilent needs and want to see somones head smashed into oblivion with a power up.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is a nice simplistic brawler, Nothing more to be said about it, the two levels so far are very creative and fun to play. The boss guys or what ever they are, are a challenge to fight and are fun to toy around with. the abillity to bunny hop around and punch thing reminds me of my good old gmod death run days and the voxel gore just adds a nice touch, and its not entirly for show either. The superpowers are also a bit of gun, a little laggy even on my beast of a machine because of all the voxel gore that stays! Nice touch. I cant wait until more levels are released. One thing I want to see though is after you win a god mode sort thing where you have infinite powers, infinite health and infite weapon durablity that can be toggled

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What can I say about Paint the Town Red that most haven't already said.

Bottom line is; after a hard days work, and your boss or girlfriend or spongy roomate got ya down, you play Paint the Town Red and fantasize the death of those closest to you. Life is hard, and one should have a healthy release. You've finished masturbating and that isn't helping. Play a round at the biker bar, kill the band, cooks, shadey backroom deal doers, and a prize winning ginger boxer.

Then you kill Whistle Tip The Pimp at the disco, and Bro'ger Dudeheim the huge inmate at the prison, and Cpt. Poopshoot Bagabones in... some port town, or whatever it is. PIRATE BAR!!! That's the ticket.

All I want in this sweet voxel world is a gun. Just one. The katana is great-- but not as great as a gun. Please gently place the shotgun, so mercilesly chilling in the Fun Zone level, into the biker bar. That's all I want.

One more thing. I love the band in the biker bar. What are they called again? anigaV waR? They're my favorite, with their one song they play over and over and over and over ...........

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun and funny looking first person fighting game. A choice of two maps for now in EA;  Bar and Disco.
Game Plot: Start a brawl in the bar or disco map, use items like kitchen knives, chairs, guitars and pool tails to decapitate your enemies. Kill  all the enemies including bosses and escape. Voilà that is your game.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nVn2QRfaAeA


Pros:
-Fun & Funny.
-Goofy looking square shaped models (minecraft anyone).
-Multiple decapitation possibilities.
-Variety of weapons
-Hidden weapons
-Bosses

Cons:
Lacks in content : * Maps
* Was hoping characters would talk to make it more fun or funny.
* Not much of a storyline.
* No replay value (this can be fixed by making additional maps)
* I hope they have more than 3 maps...(only one seemed to be missing :S)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A downright amazing little gem, especially for the price point. There is only two levels at the moment, but the next level is already planned to be a downright prison riot that I already can't wait for. An ingenious voxel-based system that doesn't feel like a gimmick but rather an amazing way to provide gore and destruction that looks and feels satisfying. A combat system simplistic yet effective, providing kills and tricks that just feel right. And to top it all off, the devs seem genuinely devoted to this game and even have dev logs that you can find in the discussions.

This isn't to say there are no issues however, of the two levels the second one feels a bit underwhelming; and in a game with only two at the moment that's a pretty big deal. I've had times when I felt like I should be hitting someone yet they mysteriously take little to no damage. The devs expect glitches though, and judging from the stuff I've already seen in discussions they'll surely listen to any bugs and errors that are noticable. But DO NOT let that stop you from purchasing this game, there is an insane level of potential here, and for $9.99 it's practically a steal.

Seriously people, I think we found a good one.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is amazing. While right now there isn't a whole lot to do, what there is to do is pure gold. Absolutely ♥♥♥♥♥♥ic gore effects (no homo) with the beautiful voxel artstyle is perfect. Your character doesn't feel sluggish, allowing you to freely move quickly and effectively around the area. Neither are you too powerful, or not powerful enough. Of course you can outsmart A.I., but getting kills will charge a meter that will give you some neat abilities (they really need to fix it though, shockwave is the first one you get and is still the best). Taking hits will be very punishing, but landing jabs and blows without being hit and seeing your enemies skull evaporate is very satisfying. Ever level is chock full of tiny interactions and funny bits. In the bar you can break railings by throwing objects, in the club you can find mother♥♥♥♥ing ninja stars to decimate your enemies, or even use stacks of money for a hilarious beatdown. (Also, you get a ♥♥♥♥ing insta-kill katana, that's pretty cool). It does need a few more levels, but I would prefer a handful of good levels with some aspects that change everytime you play (enemy placement, weapon availability/placement, etc.) rather than a ton of bad maps.  For an early access game, this game is amazing, and you should pick it up now if you love some gorey fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While having an entertaining idea behind it and excellent developers, I feel that the game in it's current state is not worth an average consumer's money to play. While an interesting idea that is well executed, it is very much a spectator game that lacks enough in game goals to be fun to play for an average gamer.

I think some edits to the enemy AI could be done in order to make the mid game battle less like a swarm, and also perhaps a little more variety to the levels including additional sub goals along with the main end game.

I will replay this game as it gets updated and edit my review accordingly, but as is now, I do not believe that you will get as much playtime out of the game as the amount of money you are spending is worth.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nKeeping it short and sweet: This is a $10 tech demo in Early Access that has no elements of being a game. I laughed and I cried because the tech demo is enjoyable, but for about 15 minutes then it gets repetitive. A game without progression (has two areas when it launched in Early Access), character anything, or a score system should not be considered beta or on Early Access. Put this one back in the oven and I'll pay $10 once it is a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the kind of game you play to let off steam (No pun intended). Every level feels full of weapons and cool things you can do (Knock off taps, etc.), every enemy can be killed in several ways... It's honestly a brilliant game. It's one of the best games on steam I have played.

It does lack content however, with only 3 levels, two if you don't count demo levels. And the levels do get a little stale after a while. But I'm sure those will be added in the future. (If you're reading this, devs, I hope a museum level with paintings, bits of sculptures, and medieval weaponry all usable as weapons is added. Just a suggestion.)

This game deserves a 10/10. It's all a game needs to be, fun, replayable, and brilliant.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, I believe that this game is a must-have for Sandbox and physically focused games players. The graphics are retro but it's easy to see how recent this game is. You'll need a powerful computer though, since it may look laggy and slowed down which is unpleasant. Overall, the game in itself is greatly orchestrated and will put the player in a moment of intense bloodshed at the frontier of reality... it's safe to say that with all the carnage going on in a single game, you could easily be rotting in jail for about 9 or 10 human lives.

To sum it up, if you're affraid of blood and violence, you may possibly have a blackout. Because a blood-stained screen is guaranteed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: It's fun, and it's worth the $10 I payed for it, but I can't guarantee that you'd feel the same.

First off, let me just say that I am giving this a thumbs up because it is an early access game. If this was being sold simply as is
date: I'd say it'd only be worth 5, maybe 6 dollars. How'd I come up with that number? If you enjoy these types of games, at a bare minimum, this game will be new" for 2 or 3 hours
recommended: and continue to be highly enjoyable for a while after that. 5 to 6 dollars is about the same price as a movie ticket
hoursPlayed: which nets you 1-2 hours of enjoyment.\n\nBut
voteText: the game isn't being sold as is. It's being updated weekly
helpfulPercent: continually adding new content
votesTotal: and replayability. They might add an amazing new feature
commentsCount: or they might add something that's horrible. But that's the point. If something sucks
column17: let SEG know. If you have an idea for something that would make the game better
column18: let them know. You can change and steer the direction of development.\n\nNow
column19: the number one issue with Early Access games is devs not delivering on promises
column20: or jumping ship with your money after a few updates. But here's the great thing about this game; although I'd be ♥♥♥♥♥♥ if the devs dropped off the face of the earth
column21: it's already enjoyable enough that I'm willing to pay $10 for it
column23: which is why I only gave it a "value" of 5 to 6 dollars."

You can't put too much hate on a game that's in early access, unless there really is no potential for it. This game has a huge potential to be something great; it's funny, surprising and hey, there's tons of gore! That's probably what everyone cares about, but oh well. I reccomend this game to anyone who likes stealing the microphone from a singer only to have knives, chairs, and fists thrown at your head. Have fun, and good luck to the Devs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was a little wary of the squared off blocky graphics at first but after actually playing the game I really like the look and feel of the game and the graphics work gorily well, and there is a lot of gore.
As soon as I cracked a glass tankard over some bloke hanging by the bar and opened up his face I was hooked, this game is brilliant and insane!
It could possibly be the most violent game I've played and also maybe one of the funniest, it is also a little bit educational as you can see how long you would still be standing if a real fight broke out, that would be not long by the way.
Get it you wont regret it. 10/10

I did a short video showing the basics of the gameplay.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KMEcaNOmB3A

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amazing! You can grab someine's afro comb and shank them in the face until there skull is visible! It is VERY VERY gory and violent but don't worry, if your squemish, it won't turn you away as the enemies are voxel based and the blood looks silly. It is over the top and not realistic in terms of how much damage the weapons can do but if it was realistic, I would not be giving it a good review as it is hilarious and entertaining, espeically when some of the bugs happen such as ragdolls getting trapped by doors and flinging around.

Pros:

A lot of replayability.
More to come.
Fun.
You can use almost anything as a weapon.
A variety of weapons.
Detailed damage system (You can sever limbs, slice of heads, etc).

Cons:

At this time there are only three levels plus a bonus sandbox level but it IS in Alpha.
Occasional bug or two but they can be funny!
Optimization is not the best but this is expected in an Alpha.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is VERY fun. It is a great idea with wonderful pixel-graphics combined with detailed gore effects. The killing is very fun and walking around at the end of a level and witnessing all the carnage left over is amazing! I know this is early access but it is worth every penny! Developers are providing weekly updates to fix bugs and add new content.

MESSAGE TO DEVELOPERS: I really enjoy the game even at this early stage, the things i'd love to see (i bet you are working on these things already anyways but) are larger maps, not too many guns (or limited ammo), LOTS of melee weapons and maybe interative environments (slighty more destruction / fire / water).

Early Access Review

I have to say, I bought this thinking I was going to regret it, but I'm glad to say that I was wrong.

While the mechanics are simple, it's the execution of them is what's great.
You esentially just start mass-riots/brawls and then proceed to kill everyone in the room, hell you even get god like powers if you kill enough blokes to fill a power meter.

The game occasionally tosses in tough/boss characters like bikers, and 6'5 tall giants who hit hard
date: and won't go down easily.\n\nIt feels AMAZING being the sole survivor in a fight
hoursPlayed: and seeing the floor of blood you made with everyone's faces."

Early Access Review

I love this game, even though I have beaten all the remaining levels its fun to replay them, The creaters should keep making it so every new area you get in has a new array of weapons, for example, the bar has pretty much all basic weapons , knives, barstools and chairs, and machetes and cleavers. The disco club introduces new weapons such as throwing stars, katanas, nun chuks, and lethal hair picks of death. And the prison has a very unique arsenal with weights, bars, fruit, pans, tazers, shives, and night sticks.
This game is a blast to play and a recommend it to everyone who is bored and wants to feel like a complete badass.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ever come home from work and launch GTA just to go into a bar and murder people senselessly?
Ever wonder what that would feel like merged with Minecraft and Shadow Warrior?

Gameplay/Concept -  10/10
The concept behind this game is great and the over the top violence is fantastic and therapeutic. There's not much of a storyline but this isn't the kind of game that needs one. It's sandbox violence at its finest.

Art/Style - 10/10
Every time you hit someone it will either leave a bruise or remove part of the voxel based model of their body. When you slam them with a bottle you can see the layers of muscle and bone - even down to the brain. Goreboner.

Current Content - 6/10
This is an early access game and it currently only has two levels (Biker Bar and Disco Club) while I'm posting this. It has a plan for a new level (Prison Riot) and I'm sure there will be plenty more. It should be understood that it is Early Access and this really isn't a negative towards the game thus far since you get what you pay for and grow with the game and the developers.

Sound/Music - 8/10
The two levels have different live bands/djs. The bar has a rock band that can get involved in the fight. Take the mic stand and slam it into his square head. Disco club has a DJ. No mic stand but find something else and repeat operation Slam into Square Head".

Overall  - 8/10
I'm excited to see where this game goes because the current idea is something I've been searching for in a game for years. Ever since I spawned a line of Kleiners in Garrys Mod and ran them over with a bathtub.

Highly recommended buy for any sandbox gore fans out there."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game because I was bored and didn't have anything else that CounterStrike to play, figured that it would be a good time waster for an hour or so. Spent way more time messing around with it than I had first anticipated, it's great, gory fun! Almost everything in the level can be used as a weapon and they all feel very satisfying to use (who wouldn't like to bash someone's skull into small bloody bits with a baseball bat?).

Do note that this game is still in Early Access at the time that I am writing this review and there are currently only two levels in the game, I found them to have a lot of replayability though, probably because I have issues since I just love the gory carnage that this game has to offer!

Definitely worth it's price, especially considering that there is more of pretty much everything still to come!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game because I was bored and didn't have anything else that CounterStrike to play, figured that it would be a good time waster for an hour or so. Spent way more time messing around with it than I had first anticipated, it's great, gory fun! Almost everything in the level can be used as a weapon and they all feel very satisfying to use (who wouldn't like to bash someone's skull into small bloody bits with a baseball bat?).

Do note that this game is still in Early Access at the time that I am writing this review and there are currently only two levels in the game, I found them to have a lot of replayability though, probably because I have issues since I just love the gory carnage that this game has to offer!

Definitely worth it's price, especially considering that there is more of pretty much everything still to come!

(Will rewrite this review at some point, too tired to go way too in depth at the moment).

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPretty much a 3D Hotline Miami. Your objective is to murder everyone in the location, by any means necessary. There's no real rhyme or reason as to why you have to, but that's the fun part because you create the story. Say you had one too many drinks and decided to bash that guys head in, say this one guy owed you money, or just looked at you wrong, teach him a lesson in pain and beat him with a pool stick. You can literally use just about anything to maim and incapacitate your foes in the game, and that's one of the best parts. Ever wanted to grab a guitar and break it over someones head? Poke a dude with a mic stand and leave a gaping hole? Break a pool stick into someones head? Well, all that and more is possible. Great stress reliever or just screwing around, very enjoyable game with more to come. 11/10 -IGN""

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While there arent many levels, the combat is so fun and refreshing. The art style and the way you damage and kill others is great looks amazing. You are also not some god with unlimited health, you can be easily killed but its also at the same time a very easy game as long as you run around. I thnik it has potential to become one of the best fighting games ever. Its worth the price for sure, and especially on a sale id highly recommend this to anyone who likes mindless killing and combat

I do have some cons
Enemy AI is really dumb, and they are easy to kill (you really only die by getting swarmed)
Weapons break too easily or not easily enough (a wine glass can last longer than a baseball bat)
I hit or kill someone in a shower and the WHOLE PRISON knows it happened (maybe some sort of detection thing like if i killed a man in plain sight ya i get it but i kill them in the shower and everyone knows?)
Overall the pros far outweigh the cons and the game is still super fun and worth the $10
Some will say you dont get enough play time for the cost, but i think you do and theres alot more to come.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is very good for an early access, and I'm glad to see that it's still being worked on dilligantly.

However, there are a few things this game could have to improve I believe.
1. Armor and/or Health recovery - The enemies do hit hard after all, some more than others, and while it is still possible to win without these, it's rather difficult, especially the pirate level, so something to restore some health or something to add some armor would help a bit, or at least make it optional.
2. Co-op Multiplayer - This is the type of game that would benefit MASSIVELY from being able to play with friends if possible, and add tremendously to replay factor.
3. Smarter Ai - I'm cutting it some slack since it's early access and it's a beat-em-up, but the AI needs some work on it.

Other than that, I haven't run into anything yet, and I really like this game, and hoping it will continue to get even better.

This game is what I waste my life on. It's hilarious, fun, and a great game.
Some map suggestions I have are:

-Super fun

Some things I dislike:
-Some levels are too short, and some weapons seem boring. Maybe that was the intention, but meh.
-Modifiers are a bit boring. Machete time, Random friends, and Random weapons aren't really good modifiers.

I love this game, and the things I dislike about this game aren't bad. I would recommend this to anyone who likes blood and gore, and bashing a person's head in with a chair.

Early Access Review

This is the kind of game you play to let off steam (No pun intended). Every level feels full of weapons and cool things you can do (Knock off taps, etc.), every enemy can be killed in several ways... It's honestly a brilliant game. It's one of the best games on steam I have played.

It does lack content however, with only 3 levels, two if you don't count demo levels. And the levels do get a little stale after a while. But I'm sure those will be added in the future. (If you're reading this, devs, I hope a museum level with paintings, bits of sculptures, and medieval weaponry all usable as weapons is added. Just a suggestion.)

This game deserves a 10/10. It's all a game needs to be, fun, replayable, and brilliant.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This Game is really cool and good I've looked at the negative reviews and have also seen the pros and cons to this game but I find that there are more pros than cons in this game

Pros:
- 3 levels (so far) excluding sandbox that are incredibly immersive you could use anything as a weapon and beat the ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Out of someone
- An awesome sandbox level where the sky is the limit you could go from chucking chairs at people to using a light sabre to slice and dice

- All 3 levels (excluding sandbox) are very big and fun to explore my favourite personally Is the prison level

- REPLAY ABILITY that's all I have to say here

- In my opinion I like doing mini role plays in games why I enjoy Garry's mod and other and paint the town red is no exception here, here I could make up a role play in seconds for each individual level including the sandbox even

- Hundreds of weapons ( most likely an exaggeration ) like bar stools too katana's

- Power ups don't you just to shockwave people and just watch physics me too so I love power ups and don't forget beserk and smite both awesome aswell

Cons

- is quite laggy for such a simple game I can reach usually 20-40 foes which may be a lot for some people but just saying

- it's quite sad to see a game so much potential not being updated enough  I know you update weekly but I had a look at the potential release date for a big change and it wouldn't be until the end of January

- Friends I want more friends/allies pls

- and finally this game's last con is, it's too easy maybe you could rate the levels on a 1-5 scale on how hard with 5 being difficult and 1 being easy in my opinion I would rate the biker brawl level (the bar) a 2 out of 5 because this level can offer a challenge at the start of the of the game but gets easier and easier but still as fun th club beat down level (the disco)
That one would probably be a 3-4 out of 5 because this level is actually a little challenge and is always difficult to take down that katana boss thingy the prison level I would give a 3 out of 5 because it is the biggest map in the game so far but it's easy in some places and harder in some places.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A simple premise and a simple game that provides enjoyment far greater than the apparent sum of its parts.

At the time of this writing there are only three stages and one sandbox level, and all four are quite enjoyable and sustain many replays due to the varied tactics you can employ and the outcomes that result.

This game performs exactly as advertised and I greatly appreciate that, no disappointing surprises. It's a mirthfully violent low-poly beat em up which packs plenty of unexpected humor that keeps you chuckling from one battered opponent to the next.
