reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game... where to start? My friend gifted me this game for Christmas. I went into it completely blind. Allthough I haven't played much yet, these few hours have been the most fun I've ever had with a video game in years. The pixel-y style of graphics perfectly fits the game. Every single level is unique, fun, and interesting and the gameplay is incredibly enjoyable. The only downside is a lack of content. There are only three levels to play, and one sandbox level. I understand that the game is still in development, but I would suggest maybe adding new levels would make the game much better.

If you're looking for a quick, fun, and unique bit of gameplay, Paint the Town Red is for you.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is probably one of the most gory games I've ever played, and I hella love it. If you've had a bad day at school, work, anything, this game is for you. Hell, you don't even have to be angry, it's always fun, and all the suggestions are read, which to me is pretty awesome compared to other games that when you write a suggestion is never read. In relation to that, the developers and forum moderators are almost always active on the forums. This game is constantly training you for bar fights, murder-discos, prison fights and more to come soon! You never know when you might get in a bar fight. To sum up this badass game, it's amazing if you're energetic and like I said, had a bad day, anything, this is one hell of a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DayZ: In Early Access for roughly 3 years, priced at $34.99, entertainment value: Low.

Paint the Town Red: In Early Access for roughly 3 months, priced at $9.99, entertainment value: ♥♥♥♥♥♥icly entertaining﻿.

Paint the Town Red will see you going to various locations and stabbing, slashing, punching, kicking, and brutalising everyone in sight using various weapons scattered across the map. That being said, the AI opponents populating each map will not only fight eachother, but will also attempt to stab, slash, punch, kick, and brutalize you just as much you would to them. They can also take advantage of the weapons that they find, giving them a heafty boost to their damage output.

This is also a very challenging game that will take you multiple tries to fully master the levels. If you don't feel like going through that, you can always set the optional level modifiers on. These are special perks" if you will that give you abilities such as your fists acting as tazers. Or grant you UNLIMITED POWWWEERRRR. Spawning random weapons across the level
date: or the ability to turn theme off completely
recommended: leaving it to a good ol' fisticuff brawl. There are more after that
hoursPlayed: which further extend replayability.\n\nThis is the most fun I have had with an indie game in a while. I like to think of this as a mix of Minecraft (Graphics) and the blood

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Have you had a stressful day? Do you want to wring someones neck? Tired of human life? If you've answered yes to any of these questions then you are in luck. Paint the Town Red is just the thing any psycho such as yourself can play to take a load off their shoulders, or take a head off someones' shoulders... hehe.....
Now you can have your cake and kill someone with it too! Highly recommended for anyone that's had a stressful day. Or if you're just in to killing people with soap and watching their limbs fly everywhere. Although the weapons have the durability of the spines that you're breaking, it is still an amazing game nonetheless.
Have fun you sick sociopath.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are looking for a brainless barfight simulator this game is the best option!
+Voxel models (looks damn amazing)
+Raw brutality, much blood, realistic injuries
+Pretty bugless
+Weekly updates (mostly)

-There are no cons that would ruin your game, all of them are fixed right now (in my opinion)

Summary: Great game to play with after a hardworking day, or after a school day. Just relax :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely brilliant! For a game that's in early access this has to be one of the best games I've ever played. I have to point out that not everyone will be able to run this game, but keep in mind that this is an indie game. It runs super smooth on my GTX 970 and I do believe future updates of this game will surely allow more people to be able to run this smoothly.

This game may not be too fun for everyone, but this game, for me, is perfect. I love the fact that the blood particles actually stick to whatever they hit and even cause said splatter to have a reflecting texture. Also, imagine the world of minecraft, but instead of a world and lands the people in the bar consist of all the blocks and they're fully destructible.

10/10 would chop a person in half with a baseball bat again.

Keep up the amazing work devs! Don't let naysayers get you down. This game is amazing and that's that.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo far this is a really great game and I am addicted. Although there is one thing that is sort of iffy and its sort of on my part. But if there could be like a setting controlling how many are in a room so the framerate wouldn't be ♥♥♥♥♥♥ for slower computers, that would be an nice feature to have and I would play more often. It seems to go in slow motion but it is still fun to play when I'm just bored and want some simple, yet bloody entertainment. But awesome game and I can't wait to see how it turns out in the long run.
